items.translated_title: Huawei’s Kirin 9030 processor shows China’s chip progress despite US export curbs: report

images.alt: Huawei’s flagship Mate 80 series smartphones. Photo: Handout
images.title: Huawei’s flagship Mate 80 series smartphones. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Huawei Technologies’ latest Mate 80 series smartphones are powered by an upgraded in-house chip after its foundry partner made improvements to the 7-nanometre node process despite US export restrictions on advanced technology, according to a new report.
The Kirin 9030, the processor behind Huawei’s Mate 80 Pro Max, was manufactured by China’s top foundry Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) using the N+3 process, which is a “scaled evolution” of the chipmaker’s previous 7-nm...

items.title: Chinese expert calls for world models and safety standards for embodied AI
items.creator: Wency Chen

items.translated_title: Chinese expert calls for world models and safety standards for embodied AI

images.alt: A robot dog is tested at the International Embodied Intelligence Skills Competition. Photo: Handout
images.title: A robot dog is tested at the International Embodied Intelligence Skills Competition. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Andrew Yao Chi-chih, a world-renowned Chinese computer scientist, said embodied artificial intelligence still lacks key foundations, stressing the need for interpretable “world models” and more diverse data-collection methods.
Speaking on Saturday at an industry event in Shanghai, Yao said core capabilities such as “reasoning, planning and control should ultimately be integrated within a unified framework”, noting the importance of world models instead of simulating. He added that “scalable new...

items.title: Why Nvidia’s H200 is unlikely to derail chip ambitions of China’s Huawei, Moore Threads
items.creator: Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Why Nvidia’s H200 is unlikely to derail chip ambitions of China’s Huawei, Moore Threads

images.alt: The H200 is the latest generation of Nvidia’s Hopper-series chips. Photo: Handout
images.title: The H200 is the latest generation of Nvidia’s Hopper-series chips. Photo: Handout

items.content:
The US approval for Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence processors will give China a much-needed boost in computing power rather than pose a direct threat to domestic chips, even though the US chip is more powerful than rivals from Huawei Technologies and Moore Threads, according to analysts.
With a total processing performance (TPP) of 15,832, the H200 has surpassed all AI chips made by domestic vendors on the market so far as well as Nvidia’s H20, which was previously the most advanced...

items.title: Kimi developer Moonshot shows China’s growing AI depth: US government report
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Kimi developer Moonshot shows China’s growing AI depth: US government report

images.alt: Zhipu AI is another Chinese AI company identified in an end-of-year review as among major contributors to the global open-source AI landscape. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: Zhipu AI is another Chinese AI company identified in an end-of-year review as among major contributors to the global open-source AI landscape. Photo: Shutterstock

items.content:
Leading Chinese artificial intelligence start-up Moonshot AI has been singled out as evidence of the “growing depth” of China’s AI industry, according to a new US government report.
An increasing number of Chinese companies were now developing world-leading “open-weight” AI models, not just DeepSeek, the Center for AI Standards and Innovation (CAISI) at the Department of Commerce said on Friday.
The CAISI report was the second US government evaluation of a leading Chinese model developer, after...

items.translated_title: Arm China, AI start-up RabbitPre among mainland Chinese tech firms expanding in Hong Kong
items.content:
A growing number of mainland Chinese tech firms are tapping Hong Kong for research talent and overseas expansion, as the Asian financial hub moves to attract Big Tech and start-ups to boost its technology sector.
Arm China, the Chinese unit of British semiconductor firm Arm Holdings, would establish a chip intellectual property research and development centre in Hong Kong in 2026 that would focus on artificial intelligence and robotics, Arm China senior technical director Zou Wei said last...

items.title: China’s AI sector poised for growth despite US tech restrictions, venture capitalist says

items.translated_title: China’s AI sector poised for growth despite US tech restrictions, venture capitalist says

images.alt: Zhou Qi, managing partner of GSR United Capital. Photo: Handout
images.title: Zhou Qi, managing partner of GSR United Capital. Photo: Handout

items.content:
China’s artificial intelligence still needs to improve in six aspects, from ecosystem to funding, but the emergence of DeepSeek has significantly boosted the sector’s confidence in overcoming US restrictions, according to a mainland venture capital firm.
China and the US were the two top players in global AI development, with the former leading in humanoid robotics and open-source large language models, according to Zhou Qi, managing partner of GSR United Capital, which focuses on early-stage...

items.title: China’s Unitree teases platform allowing users to control robots through smartphones
items.creator: Danielle Popov

items.translated_title: China’s Unitree teases platform allowing users to control robots through smartphones
items.content:
Humanoid robot maker Unitree Robotics has teased what it calls the world’s first humanoid robot “app store”, a developer platform designed to bring embodied intelligence into everyday life by allowing users to access and control robots directly through their smartphones.
The Hangzhou-based robotics unicorn unveiled a centralised programme, dubbed the Unitree Robotics Developer Platform, offering functions such as datasets and remote control programmes for humanoids. Unitree called it the...

items.title: Stuck in the factory: how robotics pioneer Japan missed the AI-driven humanoid boom
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Stuck in the factory: how robotics pioneer Japan missed the AI-driven humanoid boom
items.content:
While humanoid robots from China and the US have captured the imagination of people for their skill at serving drinks, taking part in boxing matches and running marathons, and entertaining through dance moves on stage, their counterparts in Japan – the long-time leader of the robotics world – are mostly confined to factories.
Japan’s early forays into humanoids date back to the 1960s, so what happened along the way?
At the 26th International Robot Exhibition (IREX), a four-day, biennial industry...

items.translated_title: China’s EV battery giants wade into shipbuilding to bolster Beijing’s dominance

images.alt: People visit a model of a nuclear-powered container ship at Marintec China 2025 in Shanghai on December 2, 2025. Photo: Getty Images
images.title: People visit a model of a nuclear-powered container ship at Marintec China 2025 in Shanghai on December 2, 2025. Photo: Getty Images

items.content:
China’s leading battery makers for electric cars – Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL) and Gotion High-tech – are adding momentum to the country’s efforts to build new-energy vessels, with their latest products supplied to large ocean carriers amid an accelerated decarbonisation drive.
Chinese-made pure electric-powered container vessels were also set to extend Beijing’s lead over global rivals in shipbuilding, according to industry officials and analysts.
CATL, the world’s largest electric...

items.title: China narrows AI gap with US 3 years after initial ChatGPT shock
items.creator: Ben Jiang,Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China narrows AI gap with US 3 years after initial ChatGPT shock
items.content:
US start-up OpenAI’s launch of ChatGPT on November 30, three years ago, sent China’s technology industry scrambling to get up to speed on the latest artificial intelligence developments.
Chinese government authorities sent urgent requests to various experts, including professors from Tsinghua University, to provide briefings on the implications of generative AI technology, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
China’s Big Tech firms and ambitious start-ups rushed to roll out their...

items.title: Role reversal: Meta adopts Qwen as Chinese AI becomes industry foundation

items.translated_title: Role reversal: Meta adopts Qwen as Chinese AI becomes industry foundation

images.alt: Meta released its flagship Llama family of AI models in February 2023. Photo: Shutterstock Images
images.title: Meta released its flagship Llama family of AI models in February 2023. Photo: Shutterstock Images

items.content:
When US tech giant Meta Platforms released its flagship Llama family of artificial intelligence models in February 2023, they were open-sourced, a move that singled it out among global AI model developers at the time.
That September, one of the many derivatives of Llama was announced: Alibaba Cloud’s Qwen. The first generation of Qwen adopted Llama’s training process and cited Meta's seminal research findings in its accompanying technical report.
Out of deference, the Chinese researchers even...

items.title: Chinese robotaxi firm Pony.ai bets on ‘asset-light’ strategy for growth
items.creator: Ben Jiang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese robotaxi firm Pony.ai bets on ‘asset-light’ strategy for growth
items.content:
Chinese autonomous-driving technology firm Pony.ai is betting on an “asset-light” strategy and newer generations of low-cost driverless cars to drive growth for its robotaxi operation as the company expects to break even by 2030.
Under the asset-light model, Pony.ai would team up with third-party companies – such as taxi operators or ride-hailing platforms – that would fund the deployment of its robotaxi fleet, according to Leo Wang Haojun, chief financial officer.
Instead of taking on the full...

images.alt: The smart glasses AI payment solution gives developers an easy path to build payment functions into their applications. Photo: Sina
images.title: The smart glasses AI payment solution gives developers an easy path to build payment functions into their applications. Photo: Sina

items.content:
Alipay and artificial intelligence glasses maker Rokid have jointly unveiled a smart glasses payment solution on the Rokid Lingzhu AI development platform, giving developers an easy path to build payment functions into their applications.
Based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP), an open-source standard that connects AI applications to external systems, the service allowed developers to easily integrate pre-built capabilities, such as receiving payments, by adding plug-ins, according to a...

items.translated_title: Huawei bolsters AI ambitions with dedicated foundation model unit, recruits global talent

images.alt: The AI foundation model unit was established under Huawei’s 2012 Laboratories. Photo: DigiTimes
images.title: The AI foundation model unit was established under Huawei’s 2012 Laboratories. Photo: DigiTimes

items.content:
Huawei Technologies is doubling down on foundation models with a newly formed unit, heating up the race for dominance among Chinese tech giants in the artificial intelligence sector.
The AI foundation model unit was established under Huawei’s 2012 Laboratories, the company’s strategic research and development arm that covered domains ranging from wireless technology to AI, according to a report by Chinese media outlet China Star Markets this week.
The department was actively recruiting AI...

images.alt: Presenting the FSDC paper are, from left, Au King-lun, Andrew Weir, Benjamin Hung and Rocky Tung. Photo: Enoch Yiu
images.title: Presenting the FSDC paper are, from left, Au King-lun, Andrew Weir, Benjamin Hung and Rocky Tung. Photo: Enoch Yiu

items.content:
Hong Kong will need to attract global champion firms across different sectors to raise funds to strengthen the city’s role as an international financial centre over the next 10 years, according to a concept paper issued by the Financial Services Development Council (FSDC) on Friday.
“Global markets do not stand still,” said Benjamin Hung Pi-cheng, chairman of the FSDC, at a media briefing where the council outlined a wide range of ideas to bring the city’s capital market to the next level. “Hong...

items.translated_title: ‘China’s little Nvidia’ Moore Threads warns of overheating risks after 723% share surge

images.alt: Founded by James Zhang in 2020, Moore Threads is now focusing on AI accelerator chips for training large language models. Photo: Handout
images.title: Founded by James Zhang in 2020, Moore Threads is now focusing on AI accelerator chips for training large language models. Photo: Handout

items.content:
A more than eight-fold surge in the share price of Chinese graphics processing unit (GPU) maker Moore Threads Technology has prompted the newly listed company to warn investors that the gains may have run ahead of fundamentals.
The Beijing-based chipmaker said in a statement to the Shanghai Stock Exchange on Friday that its shares could face the risk of declines after the rapid rally. There was no catalyst that needed to be disclosed and no material change in the company’s fundamentals, it...

images.alt: MiniMax founder Yan Junjie is focusing on developing multimodal AI models. Photo: Handout
images.title: MiniMax founder Yan Junjie is focusing on developing multimodal AI models. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence start-up MiniMax plans to channel funds from its proposed Hong Kong initial public offering (IPO) into research and development as it seeks to compete with global and domestic rivals, according to a person familiar with the matter.
With 70 per cent of its revenue generated overseas, MiniMax was targeting Hong Kong’s international investor base and capital market, the person said.
The Shanghai-based firm, backed by Alibaba Group Holding and Tencent Holdings, was...

items.content:
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is rapidly cementing its position as a global leader in the digital asset sector on the back of its regulatory infrastructure and the institutional adoption of cryptocurrencies, according to industry insiders at the fourth edition of Abu Dhabi Finance Week (ADFW).

items.translated_title: China’s Huawei ramps up foldable smartphone battle with global launch of slim Mate X7

images.alt: Huawei held nearly 70 per cent of China’s foldable market in the first three quarters of this year. Photo: Handout
images.title: Huawei held nearly 70 per cent of China’s foldable market in the first three quarters of this year. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Huawei Technologies is reinforcing its position in the foldable smartphone segment with the global launch of the Mate X7, as the market awaits Apple’s much-anticipated foldable iPhone and digests the recent announcement of Samsung Electronics’ first trifold.
Priced at 2,099 euros (US$2,445), the Huawei Mate X7, which was released in China last month, features a thickness of 4.5mm (0.2 inches) when unfolded. The device, including the battery, weighs up to 236 grams.
It was rolled out globally at...

items.translated_title: China’s Xreal to power Google’s Android AI glasses as smart eyewear demand grows
items.content:
Chinese augmented reality start-up Xreal has teamed up with Google on Project Aura, a venture to launch artificial intelligence glasses powered by the Android XR operating system and Gemini AI next year, in a fresh example of Chinese capabilities in research and development.
Project Aura, resembling a pair of thick sunglasses, was first announced at Google’s annual I/O developer conference in May. The device runs on Android XR, a unified platform for extended reality (XR) devices built through a...
